item.title: [Java] jAP IRC bot
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Rixxx, post:7, topic:358907”][code=java]package com.ircbot;

import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.OutputStreamWriter;
import java.net.Socket;
import java.net.UnknownHostException;

/**

  • A new bot!!!

  • @author Rix
    */
    public class Main {

    /**

    • The main method.
    • @param args The arguments.
    • @throws IOException If there’s any connection error.
    • @throws UnknownHostException If the host is invalid.
      /
      public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException, UnknownHostException {
      /       Settings. /
      boolean connected = false;
      int port = 6667;
      String address = “”; // address to connect to
      String channel = “”; // irc channel
      String nick = “”; // bot nickname
      String server = “”; // server to connect to
      String user = “”; // bot username
      try {
      // a new socket
      Socket irc = new Socket(server, port);
      BufferedWriter bw = new BufferedWriter(
      new OutputStreamWriter(irc.getOutputStream())
      );
      BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(
      new InputStreamReader(irc.getInputStream())
      );
      Bot ircbot = new Bot(bw, channel);
      ircbot.login(nick, address);
      String line = null;
      while((line = br.readLine()) != null) {
      System.out.println(""+line+"\n");
      String parts[] = line.split(" “, 3);
      if (parts[1].equals(“KICK”)) {
      ircbot.rejoin();
      } else if (parts[1].equals(“PRIVMSG”)) {
      parts = parts[2].split(” ", 2);
      channel = parts[0];
      String msg = parts[1].substring(1);
      /       A few commands… */
      if (msg.equals("!random")) {
      ircbot.say(RetardedShit.getText());
      }
      if (msg.equals("!lol")) {
      ircbot.say(RetardedShit.getYoMommaJokes());
      }
      if (msg.equals("!spam")) {
      for (int i = 1; i < 6; i++) {
      ircbot.say(“Spam spam spam spam spam!”);
      }
      }
      }
      }
      } catch (UnknownHostException u) {
      throw new UnknownHostException(“No such host!”);
      } catch (IOException io) {
      throw new IOException(“Error connecting!”);
      }
      }

}[/code][/quote]
I hope this is a joke.

Read full topic

item.title: [Java] jAP IRC bot
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

I’ve told you this about a million times but you wont listen:
STOP HARDCODING EVERYTHING IN AND STUFFING IT INTO THE MAIN METHOD!

I’ve learnt it the hard way: program nicely in the first place before you hit any major flaws.
You’re code prevents you from joining multiple irc servers.
It has no convenient methods like join(String msg), quit(String msg), say(String chan,String msg)
It’s so hard to work with and modify.

I’ve already posted this to you but you ignored it:

import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.net.Socket;

public class Main {

    private PrintWriter out;
    private BufferedReader in;
    private Socket s;

    public Main(String server, int port, String nick, String[] channels) throws IOException {
        s = new Socket(server, port);
        in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(s.getInputStream()));
        //BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new OutputStreamWriter(s.getOutputStream()));
        out = new PrintWriter(s.getOutputStream(), true);  // autoflush

        login(nick);
        join(channels);

        String line;
        while ((line = in.readLine()) != null) {
            System.out.println(line);
            parseLine(line);
        }
    }

    private void login(String nick) {
        out.write("NICK " + nick + "\n");
        out.write("USER " + nick + " * * :bot\n");
        out.flush();
    }

    private void join(String chan) {
        out.write("JOIN " + chan + "\n");
        out.flush();
    }

    private void join(String[] chans) {
        for (String chan : chans) {
            out.write("JOIN " + chan + "\n");
            out.flush();
        }
    }

    private void parseLine(String line) throws IOException {
        String[] split = line.split(" ");

        if (line.startsWith("PING")) {
            out.write(line.replace("PING", "PONG") + "\n");
            out.flush();
        }

        if (split[1].equals("PRIVMSG")) {


            String[] parts = line.split(":", 3);
            String msg = parts[2];
            String channel = split[2].split(":")[0];
            /* 
             *String[] user = parts[0].substring(1).split("[!@]");
             *String[] contents = line.split(":", 3);
             *String[] userInfo = contents[0].substring(1).split("[!@]");
             */
            if (msg.startsWith("kill")) {
                out.write("PRIVMSG " + channel + " :SHOT THROUGH THE HEART\n");
                out.write("PRIVMSG " + channel + " :AND YOU'RE TO BLAME\n");
                out.write("PRIVMSG " + channel + " :YOU GIVE LOVE, A BAD NAME\n");
                out.flush();
                s.close();
            }
        }
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try {
            new Main("irc.strictfp.com", 6667, "jAp", new String[]{"#icepush"});
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}

this was just a quick edit and it’s still bad but you can do better.

Read full topic
